titleStmt.title: John Faulconer et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7112

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky The undersigned citizens of the Town of Catlettsburg would respectfully represent that on the 2d day of September 1865 a fine of fifty dollars was imposed upon Peter Fobell for selling jewelry without a license we are satisfied that Fobell did not know it was a violation of Law he had a small box of Jewelry which he had been selling out of whilst in the Army to his fellow soldiers and having a remnant left he was endeavoring to sell that he sold but two articles in this state and they were of but little value we pray your Excellency to remitt so much of his fine as can be lawfully be remitted

John Faulconer
Kelsey N. Harris
R,, G,, Draper
H. C. Zeigler
James Seaten
M. M Conley
A. P. Borders
A Shine
William Ely
Martin Keeser
John Wecksler
J. A. Klaiber
G A Dudley
V M Moore
Elba Ulin
Jas, R, Ford
Jas Newman
Charles M Armstrong
Elijah Mott
Harmon Conley

Ct
vs
Peter Fobell
$50,
Peddling
Remitted 10 Oct /65
